summary: This is an email from the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch, scheduling a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The email outlines logistical details, requests staff assistance and document gathering, and provides travel arrangements for the team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the scheduled Psychological Reconstruction at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

persons.name: Warden MI
persons.context: The recipient of the email, thanked for supporting the scheduling and requested to assist with staff and document coordination for the Psychological Reconstruction.

locations: Sheraton Tribeca, 370 Canal Street, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch, 320 First Street, NW, Washington, DC 20534
keyFacts: A Psychological Reconstruction was scheduled for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York, to be conducted from August 13-15, 2019.
The reconstruction was organized by the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator of the Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch.
The reconstruction team planned to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in New York and required staff assistance from the prison for interviews and document gathering.
The email was sent on August 12, 2019, one day before the reconstruction was set to begin and less than a month before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
